summary: Build an app that provides 2D, 3D, and live (animated) wallpapers for users to browse, preview, and apply.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- App logo mark, minimal geometric style (app-logo.dim_512x512.png)
- Wallpaper thumbnail frame/background texture, subtle neutral pattern (thumb-bg.dim_512x512.png)
- Hero/background illustration with abstract shapes suitable for a wallpaper app (hero-bg.dim_1600x900.png)

existing_features.title: Create the core navigation and screens for a wallpaper app with three content types: 2D wallpapers (static images), 3D wallpapers (interactive 3D scenes), and Live wallpapers (looping/animated). Include at minimum: (1) a Browse screen with tabs/filters for 2D / 3D / Live, (2) a Wallpaper Detail/Preview screen, and (3) a Favorites screen.

Add an initial, built-in wallpaper catalog that ships with the app and supports the three types: 2D (image assets), Live (video/gif/canvas animation assets), and 3D (React Three Fiber scenes). Each catalog entry must include: id, title, type (2D|LIVE|THREE_D), thumbnail asset path, and preview configuration (asset path for 2D/LIVE; scene key/config for 3D).

Implement the 3D wallpaper previews using Three.js via React Three Fiber. Provide at least 2 distinct 3D wallpaper scenes (e.g., abstract shapes, particle field) that animate over time and support basic interaction (orbit/drag or pointer interaction) in the preview.

Implement Live wallpaper previews as animated content. Support at least one of: looping video, animated GIF, or a canvas-based animation. Ensure the preview loops smoothly and provides play/pause controls when applicable.

Add an “Apply” action on the wallpaper detail screen that works within web constraints: provide a full-screen preview mode plus a Download option for 2D/Live assets, and for 3D provide an “Export snapshot” (download a rendered image) or “Open full-screen” mode. Label user-facing UI in English.

Persist per-user favorites using Internet Identity authentication. Users should be able to favorite/unfavorite wallpapers from Browse and Detail screens; favorites must persist across reloads for the same authenticated user.
Frontend data layer: use React Query to load the wallpaper catalog and the signed-in user’s favorites, and to perform favorite mutations with optimistic UI updates and error rollback.

Choose and apply a coherent visual theme for the app (distinct color palette, typography, spacing, and component style) and use it consistently across Browse, Detail, and Favorites screens. Do not use a blue+purple theme.

Add static asset handling for wallpaper media (thumbnails + 2D images + live assets) as frontend public assets, and reference them via catalog metadata so they can be previewed and downloaded without routing through the backend.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a 2D/3D/live wallpaper app (browse, preview, and apply wallpapers)

Backend: implement a Motoko API to (a) list the wallpaper catalog metadata, and (b) manage per-principal favorites (getFavorites, addFavorite, removeFavorite). Keep all backend logic in the single main actor.

projectName: 2D / 3D / Live Wallpaper Browser, Preview, and Apply App
